You’ve since resolved to rendezvous with Crow and the others at the nearest entrance to Tethiss’s Claw, high above. You’ve equipped some different gear, as well – trading out what of your equipment suffered the curse to whatever else you have on hand. Currently, you wield your old scimitar and wear leather boots; additionally, you slide the earthsea royal signet ring onto one of the fingers of your right hand, feeling a momentary humming in your mind upon doing so.

Thus, you depart up the slopes from the Calamity Rift.

“I’m not convinced.”

There’s a long, deliberate stall. You pause in your tracks and look over your shoulder at Freya, who cocks an eyebrow at you, folding her arms.

“You’re not convinced about what, now?” She asks.

“You’re inviting me to join Freakshow, and I’m not really feeling the pitch.” You respond, giving a dismissive gesture. “You haven’t really told me why I should get involved with you – just why I shouldn’t get involved with the Alliance. You’re not lacking confidence, are you?”

“What? Never.” Freya responds. “I’m marketing to my target audience – you just happen to be a hard sell. How else could someone rub shoulders with the likes of both the Guardians and the Writ Keepers and remain guildless? I merely didn’t want to waste time feeding you impertinent information. But, if you prefer…”

“That’s enough. What does your guild actually want to achieve?” You ask. “Because orchestrating an attack on Averron City was not exactly what I’d call good PR.”

“That was a regrettable incident, yes.” She looks unperturbed. “Anaximander was rather heavy-handed in his approach – though he wanted to make a statement, and was rather successful in doing so. To be quite honest? I’m not even sure I understand now what he once hoped to achieve. The fact of the matter, though, is that we’ve secured peace.”
